item.title: Seaborn bar plot
item.description: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns import pandas as pd DATA_PATH = '/Users/yaganarun/Documents/TACTII/kaggle_learnathon/mlnotes/content/python/heart.csv'df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)df.head(3) .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } age sex cp trestbps chol fbs restecg thalach exang oldpeak slope ca thal target 0 63 1 3 145 233 1 0 150 0 2.

item.title: Useful operations on a DataFrame
item.description: import pandas as pd DATA_PATH = '/Users/yaganarun/Documents/TACTII/kaggle_learnathon/mlnotes/content/python/heart.csv'df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)df.head(2) .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } age sex cp trestbps chol fbs restecg thalach exang oldpeak slope ca thal target 0 63 1 3 145 233 1 0 150 0 2.3 0 0 1 1 1 37 1 2 130 250 0 1 187 0 3.

item.title: DataFrame apply using custom function
item.description: import pandas as pddata = ['audi is awsome ' , 'Maruthi is best' , 'Benz sucks' , 'Lambhoghini mind blowing'] df = pd.DataFrame(data , columns=['feedback'])def custom_length(sent): return len(sent) df['feedback_chars'] = df['feedback'].apply(custom_length) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } feedback feedback_chars 0 audi is awsome 15 1 Maruthi is best 15 2 Benz sucks 10 3 Lambhoghini mind blowing 24 df.

item.title: DataFrame apply using lambda function
item.description: import pandas as pd DATA_PATH = '/Users/yaganarun/Documents/TACTII/kaggle_learnathon/mlnotes/content/python/heart.csv'data = ['audi is awsome ' , 'Maruthi is best' , 'Benz sucks' , 'Lambhoghini mind blowing'] df = pd.DataFrame(data , columns=['feedback'])df['feedback_chars'] = df['feedback'].apply( lambda x: len(x) ) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } feedback feedback_chars 0 audi is awsome 15 1 Maruthi is best 15 2 Benz sucks 10 3 Lambhoghini mind blowing 24 df.

item.title: Seaborn count plot
item.description: import seaborn as sns import pandas as pd DATA_PATH = '/Users/yaganarun/Documents/TACTII/kaggle_learnathon/mlnotes/content/python/heart.csv'df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)# x must a column from your dataset sns.countplot( x = 'target' , data = df) <AxesSubplot:xlabel='target', ylabel='count'>

item.title: To find null in a DataFrame
item.description: DATA_PATH = '/Users/yaganarun/Documents/TACTII/kaggle_learnathon/mlnotes/content/python/heart.csv'df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)df.isnull() #easy with small datasets .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } age sex cp trestbps chol fbs restecg thalach exang oldpeak slope ca thal target 0 False False False False False False False False False False False False False False 1 False False False False False False False False False False False False False False 2 False False False False False False False False False False False False False False 3 False False False False False False False False False False False False False False 4 False False False False False False False False False False False False False False .

item.title: F1 Score using scikit learn
item.description: from sklearn.metrics import f1_scorey_true = [0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2] y_pred = [0, 2, 1, 0, 0, 1]f1_score_ = f1_score(y_true , y_pred , average='micro') f1_score_ 0.3333333333333333
